page.title: 04MINEHEAD POLICE & FIREMEN
page.content: {The police station}in Minehead is in Townsend road and there are 28 full time police officers,10 of whom are on duty at any one time.There are 7 police cars availble.During the summer there is one more police man employed because of the extra people here on holiday.The police spend alot of their time dealing with burgularies and accidents. {The fire service}has 2 full time fire men and 20 reserves.There are 2 fire engines and a truck.There are about 150 fires a year,some of them heath fires on the surrounding moorland. There used to be a siren at the top of a tower to call the reserves but now they carry personal bleepers.
